facts.text: Appellant Bhagwan Singh convicted of murder of Buggar Singh and sentenced to death.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant Bhagwan Singh has been companyvicted of the murder of one Buggar Singh and sentenced to death.

facts.text: Deceased fired at appellant's brother six or seven years before the occurrence.

anchor.surface_text: The prosecution story is that the appellant bore a grudge against the deceased because the deceased had fired

facts.text: Deceased sent to jail for firing at appellant's brother.

anchor.surface_text: at the appellants brother some six or seven years before the present occurrence and was sent to jail for it.

facts.text: Police took proceedings under section 107 CrPC against both sides after deceased released from jail.

anchor.surface_text: When he came out of jail the police thought it prudent to take proceedings against both sides under section 107

facts.text: Appellant's two brothers and cousins bound down under s.107, as also deceased.

facts.text: Occurrence on 7th September 1950.

facts.text: Appellant sitting at shop of Jit Singh PW2 when deceased came about 12:15 pm.

anchor.surface_text: On the date of the occurrence, the 7th of September 1950, the prosecution state that the appellant was sitting

facts.text: Deceased borrowed Rs.5 from Jit Singh and transaction entered in account book.

anchor.surface_text: at the shop of Jit Singh, P.W. 2, when the deceased came there about 12-15 p.m. and borrowed Rs. 5 from Jit Singh

facts.text: Appellant followed deceased and shot him at point blank range with pistol 4 or 5 karams from shop.

anchor.surface_text: When the deceased left the shop he was followed by the appellant who shot him at point blank range with a pistol

facts.text: Bystanders chased appellant and apprehended him after short run of 30 karams, still carrying pistol.

anchor.surface_text: only 4 or 5 karams from the shop. This attracted the attention of a number of bystanders who immediately chased

facts.text: Pistol taken from appellant by Jagir Singh Patwari PW4.

anchor.surface_text: the appellant and apprehended him after a short run of about 30 karams. He was still carrying the pistol.

facts.text: Appellant taken to local police post 100 karams distant.

anchor.surface_text: It was taken away from him by Jagir Singh Patwari, P.W. 4. The appellant was immediately taken to the local

facts.text: Jit Singh PW2 made first information report at 12:27 pm within 15 minutes of occurrence.

anchor.surface_text: police post about 100 karams distant and the shopkeeper Jit Singh, W. 2, made the first information report at 12-a7

facts.text: Motive proved by Bhag Singh PW7, believed by court.

anchor.surface_text: The motive is proved by Bhag Singh, P.W. 7, who has been believed and that part of the case was number challenged

facts.text: Occurrence witnessed by large number of persons, prosecution examined five.

anchor.surface_text: before us. The occurrence was witnessed by a large number of persons of whom the prosecution examined only five.

facts.text: Two eyewitnesses turned hostile in Sessions Court.

anchor.surface_text: Two of them turned hostile in the Sessions Court and one gave evidence which has been regarded by the High Court

anchor.surface_text: The remaining two, Balbir Singh  P.W. 5  and Jaswant Singh  P.W. 6  have been believed.

holdings.text: Sessions Court has power under section 540 CrPC to examine witnesses not examined before the Committing Magistrate.

anchor.surface_text: It is evident that the Sessions Court has power to examine wit- nesses who were not examined before the Committing Magis- trate because of section 540 of the Criminal Procedure Code,

holdings.reasoning_summary: Direct application of s540 CrPC; cases concede this power; distinguished from cases refusing examination.
